attributes.action: Ban the Practice of Giving Fish as Prizes at Fairs
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
the government rejected a ban on allowing fairs to give fish away as prizes on the grounds, i believe, that children gained pleasure from winning a 'pet', despite the cruelty and suffering of that fish. it is clearly ridiculous, given that the animal welfare act, 2006, is about protecting animals from harm.
a fish at the fair is starved of oxygen, subjected to sounds and lights that are distressing and is certainly not in a stable or suitable environment (a plastic bag).  a lot of the people that win the fish have no experience in caring for a fish, so they die very soon or suffer. 
it is illegal for an unsupervised minor to be given a fish, yet i have witnessed this happening.
i fail to see the pleasure the child gets from waking up the following morning, to find that their new 'pet' is dead (usually through starvation, chlorine poisoning, changes in temperature).
i fail to see how this practice teaches a child about the importance of animal welfare or the value of an animal. we should be showing children that it is a great responsibilty to have a pet, and thought and education needs to go into preparing to have a pet.
fish do not have a 10-second memory and they feel suffering as other animals do.
